intro: Galium patzkeanum, commonly known as the Patzke's bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing herbaceous perennial that typically reaches a height of about 10 to 20 centimeters. The plant features slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes, forming dense mats. Its small, white or pale pink flowers are arranged in whorls along the stems, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Galium patzkeanum is native to parts of Europe and is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
